Receive with MSG_PEEK failed with error: RPC-ESOCKTNOSUPPORT

test.name: two_thrds_simult
test.objective: Check robustness of the stream sockets send/receive functionality when a socket is used from two threads simultaneously.

test.name: blk_recv_two_threads
test.objective: Check that sum of data received by means of recv() is the same as sent if blocking recv() called in different threads on the same socket before data arrival. In the case of the SOCK_STREAM type connection first recv() called to get only part of data to guarantee swathing to the other thread.

test.name: recv_oob_absent
test.objective: Check that TCP socket returns -1 and errno set to EINVAL if the process asks for out-of-band data that has not been sent yet.

test.name: check_recv_truncate
test.objective: Check that on a TCP socket part of received data may be discarded by calling receive function with MSG_TRUNC flag.

test.name: send_to_incomplete
test.objective: Check that several threads may use a single socket for different socket operations.

test.name: send_more_dgram
test.objective: Check that MSG_MORE flag works with UDP sockets and in case of datagram larger than 64K EMSGSIZE is returned.

test.name: sendmsg_pktinfo
test.objective: Check that using of IP_PKTINFO/IPV6_PKTINFO with sendmsg() or sendmmsg() is taken into account in routing the outgoing packet.

test.name: sendmsg_pktinfo_src
test.objective: Check that address passed in IP_PKTINFO/IPV6_PKTINFO control message to sendmsg()/sendmmsg() affects source address of the sent packet.

test.name: send_recv_shutdown
test.objective: Check that sending/receiving data using TCP socket is terminated correctly when shutdown(RDWR) is called on the socket from another process or thread.

test.name: recv_dgram_wild
test.objective: Check support of read operations with DGRAM sockets.

test.name: peer_close
test.objective: Check behaviour of send/receive functions when peer closes its socket.

results.notes: Onload extension call onload_msg_template_alloc fails in its special way

result.verdict: Peer closed its socket, the second I/O function returned -1, but: errno is set to ENOTCONN instead of EPIPE

test.name: recvmmsg
test.objective: Test on reliability of recvmmsg() operation on BSD compatible sockets.

result.verdict: recvmmsg() get 1 packets instead of 4 packets.

results.notes: Onload's recvmmsg does not follow Linux

test.name: recv_zero_dgram
test.objective: Check receive functions behaviour when zero-length packet is received.

test.name: largebuff_via_splice
test.objective: Check sending/receiving large amount of data via a socket with splice().

test.name: fill_huge_rcvbuf
test.objective: Check what happens if a huge receive buffer is overfilled and we try to read all the data from it.

results.notes: UDP loopback is not accelerated; Linux UDP socket does not work with really huge SO_RCVBUF
